oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Review of the genus Strumigenys (Hymenoptera, Formicidae, Myrmicinae) in Hong Kong with the description of three new species and the addition of five native and four introduced species records
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Tang, Kit Lam
Guénard, Benoit
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Strumigenys
species nova
Hymenoptera
invasion biology
invasive species
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: <jats:p>The species of the ant genus<jats:italic>Strumigenys</jats:italic>Smith, 1860 found in Hong Kong are reviewed based on new sampling efforts performed over the past five years (2014–2018). Prior to this, 12<jats:italic>Strumigenys</jats:italic>species had been recorded from Hong Kong, all confirmed here. Moreover, we add to this list three newly described species:<jats:italic>S.hirsuta</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>,<jats:italic>S.lantaui</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, and<jats:italic>S.nathistorisoc</jats:italic><jats:bold>sp. n.</jats:bold>, and describe for the first time the worker caste of<jats:italic>S.formosa</jats:italic>Terayama, Lin & Wu, 1995. We report new records for nine additional species, bringing the total number of species to 24, including four newly recorded species (<jats:italic>S.hexamera</jats:italic>Brown, 1958,<jats:italic>S.membranifera</jats:italic>Emery, 1869,<jats:italic>S.nepalensis</jats:italic>Baroni Urbani and De Andrade, 1994, and<jats:italic>S.rogeri</jats:italic>Emery, 1890) which are considered to be introduced to Hong Kong. A global review of the introduced<jats:italic>Strumigenys</jats:italic>species is presented. The taxonomic validity of<jats:italic>S.feae</jats:italic>and<jats:italic>S.formosensis</jats:italic>is discussed in light of new specimen measurements. New ecological information on the swarming periods of 11 species is presented on the basis of year-long sampling of aerial insects. Finally, the importance of our results within Southeast Asia and the need for future sampling efforts in the region is discussed.</jats:p>
